00028 /*
00029  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00030  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00031  *
00032  * lustre/ofd/ofd_obd.c
00033  *
00034  * This file contains OBD API methods for OBD Filter Device (OFD) which are
00035  * used for export handling, configuration purposes and recovery.
00036  * Several methods are used by ECHO client only since it still uses OBD API.
00037  * Such methods have _echo_ prefix in name.
00038  *
00039  * Author: Andreas Dilger <andreas.dilger@intel.com>
00040  * Author: Alexey Zhuravlev <alexey.zhuravlev@intel.com>
00041  * Author: Mikhail Pershin <mike.pershin@intel.com>
00042  */
00043 
00044 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_FILTER
00045 
00046 #include <lustre/lustre_idl.h>
00047 #include "ofd_internal.h"
00048 #include <obd_cksum.h>
00049 #include <lustre_ioctl.h>
00050 #include <lustre_quota.h>
00051 #include <lustre_lfsck.h>
00052 #include <lustre_nodemap.h>
00053 
00067 static int ofd_export_stats_init(struct ofd_device *ofd,
00068                                  struct obd_export *exp,
00069                                  lnet_nid_t *client_nid)
00070 {
00071         struct obd_device       *obd = ofd_obd(ofd);
00072         struct nid_stat         *stats;
00073         int                      rc;
00074         ENTRY;
00075 
00076         LASSERT(obd->obd_uses_nid_stats);
00077 
00078         if (obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_client_uuid, &obd->obd_uuid))
00079                 /* Self-export gets no proc entry */
00080                 RETURN(0);
00081 
00082         rc = lprocfs_exp_setup(exp, client_nid);
00083         if (rc != 0)
00084                 /* Mask error for already created /proc entries */
00085                 RETURN(rc == -EALREADY ? 0 : rc);
00086 
00087         stats = exp->exp_nid_stats;
00088         stats->nid_stats = lprocfs_alloc_stats(NUM_OBD_STATS +
00089                                                 LPROC_OFD_STATS_LAST,
00090                                                 LPROCFS_STATS_FLAG_NOPERCPU);
00091         if (stats->nid_stats == NULL)
00092                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00093 
00094         lprocfs_init_ops_stats(LPROC_OFD_STATS_LAST, stats->nid_stats);
00095 
00096         ofd_stats_counter_init(stats->nid_stats);
00097 
00098         rc = lprocfs_register_stats(stats->nid_proc, "stats", stats->nid_stats);
00099         if (rc != 0) {
00100                 lprocfs_free_stats(&stats->nid_stats);
00101                 GOTO(out, rc);
00102         }
00103 
00104         rc = lprocfs_nid_ldlm_stats_init(stats);
00105         if (rc != 0)
00106                 GOTO(out, rc);
00107 
00108 out:
00109         RETURN(rc);
00110 }
00111 
00137 static int ofd_parse_connect_data(const struct lu_env *env,
00138                                   struct obd_export *exp,
00139                                   struct obd_connect_data *data,
00140                                   bool new_connection)
00141 {
00142         struct ofd_device                *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00143         struct filter_export_data        *fed = &exp->exp_filter_data;
00144 
00145         if (!data)
00146                 RETURN(0);
00147 
00148         CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "%s: cli %s/%p ocd_connect_flags: "LPX64
00149                " ocd_version: %x ocd_grant: %d ocd_index: %u"
00150                " ocd_group %u\n",
00151                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, exp,
00152                data->ocd_connect_flags, data->ocd_version,
00153                data->ocd_grant, data->ocd_index, data->ocd_group);
00154 
00155         if (fed->fed_group != 0 && fed->fed_group != data->ocd_group) {
00156                 CWARN("!!! This export (nid %s) used object group %d "
00157                       "earlier; now it's trying to use group %d!  This could "
00158                       "be a bug in the MDS. Please report to "
00159                       "https://jira.hpdd.intel.com/\n",
00160                       obd_export_nid2str(exp), fed->fed_group,
00161                       data->ocd_group);
00162                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00163         }
00164         fed->fed_group = data->ocd_group;
00165 
00166         data->ocd_connect_flags &= OST_CONNECT_SUPPORTED;
00167         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00168 
00169         /* Kindly make sure the SKIP_ORPHAN flag is from MDS. */
00170         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS)
00171                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Received MDS connection for group %u\n",
00172                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, data->ocd_group);
00173         else if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_SKIP_ORPHAN)
00174                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00175 
00176         /* Determine optimal brw size before calculating grant */
00177         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OST_BRW_SIZE)) {
00178                 data->ocd_brw_size = 65536;
00179         } else if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, BRW_SIZE)) {
00180                 data->ocd_brw_size = min(data->ocd_brw_size, ofd->ofd_brw_size);
00181                 if (data->ocd_brw_size == 0) {
00182                         CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p ocd_connect_flags: "LPX64
00183                                " ocd_version: %x ocd_grant: %d ocd_index: %u "
00184                                "ocd_brw_size is unexpectedly zero, "
00185                                "network data corruption?"
00186                                "Refusing connection of this client\n",
00187                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name,
00188                                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00189                                exp, data->ocd_connect_flags, data->ocd_version,
00190                                data->ocd_grant, data->ocd_index);
00191                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00192                 }
00193         }
00194 
00195         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, GRANT_PARAM)) {
00196                 /* client is reporting its page size, for future use */
00197                 exp->exp_filter_data.fed_pagebits = data->ocd_grant_blkbits;
00198                 data->ocd_grant_blkbits  = ofd->ofd_blockbits;
00199                 /* ddp_inodespace may not be power-of-two value, eg. for ldiskfs
00200                  * it's LDISKFS_DIR_REC_LEN(20) = 28. */
00201                 data->ocd_grant_inobits =
00202                                        fls(ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace - 1);
00203                 /* ocd_grant_tax_kb is in 1K byte blocks */
00204                 data->ocd_grant_tax_kb = ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_extent_tax >> 10;
00205                 data->ocd_grant_max_blks = ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_max_extent_blks;
00206         }
00207 
00208         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, GRANT)) {
00209                 /* Save connect_data we have so far because ofd_grant_connect()
00210                  * uses it to calculate grant. */
00211                 exp->exp_connect_data = *data;
00212                 ofd_grant_connect(env, exp, data, new_connection);
00213         }
00214 
00215         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_INDEX) {
00216                 struct lr_server_data *lsd = &ofd->ofd_lut.lut_lsd;
00217                 int                    index = lsd->lsd_osd_index;
00218 
00219                 if (index != data->ocd_index) {
00220                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x136, "Connection from %s to index"
00221                                            " %u doesn't match actual OST index"
00222                                            " %u in last_rcvd file, bad "
00223                                            "configuration?\n",
00224                                            obd_export_nid2str(exp), index,
00225                                            data->ocd_index);
00226                         RETURN(-EBADF);
00227                 }
00228                 if (!(lsd->lsd_feature_compat & OBD_COMPAT_OST)) {
00229                         /* this will only happen on the first connect */
00230                         lsd->lsd_feature_compat |= OBD_COMPAT_OST;
00231                         /* sync is not needed here as lut_client_add will
00232                          * set exp_need_sync flag */
00233                         tgt_server_data_update(env, &ofd->ofd_lut, 0);
00234                 }
00235         }
00236 
00237         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM) {
00238                 __u32 cksum_types = data->ocd_cksum_types;
00239 
00240                 /* The client set in ocd_cksum_types the checksum types it
00241                  * supports. We have to mask off the algorithms that we don't
00242                  * support */
00243                 data->ocd_cksum_types &= cksum_types_supported_server();
00244 
00245                 if (unlikely(data->ocd_cksum_types == 0)) {
00246                         CERROR("%s: Connect with checksum support but no "
00247                                "ocd_cksum_types is set\n",
00248                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name);
00249                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00250                 }
00251 
00252                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "%s: cli %s supports cksum type %x, return "
00253                        "%x\n", exp->exp_obd->obd_name, obd_export_nid2str(exp),
00254                        cksum_types, data->ocd_cksum_types);
00255         } else {
00256                 /* This client does not support OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM
00257                  * fall back to CRC32 */
00258                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "%s: cli %s does not support "
00259                        "OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM, CRC32 will be used\n",
00260                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, obd_export_nid2str(exp));
00261         }
00262 
00263         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MAXBYTES)
00264                 data->ocd_maxbytes = ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_maxbytes;
00265 
00266         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, PINGLESS)) {
00267                 if (ptlrpc_pinger_suppress_pings()) {
00268                         spin_lock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
00269                         list_del_init(&exp->exp_obd_chain_timed);
00270                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
00271                 } else {
00272                         data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_PINGLESS;
00273                 }
00274         }
00275 
00276         RETURN(0);
00277 }
00278 
00295 static int ofd_obd_reconnect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00296                              struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
00297                              struct obd_connect_data *data,
00298                              void *client_nid)
00299 {
00300         struct ofd_device       *ofd;
00301         int                      rc;
00302 
00303         ENTRY;
00304 
00305         if (exp == NULL || obd == NULL || cluuid == NULL)
00306                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00307 
00308         rc = nodemap_add_member(*(lnet_nid_t *)client_nid, exp);
00309         if (rc != 0 && rc != -EEXIST)
00310                 RETURN(rc);
00311 
00312         ofd = ofd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00313 
00314         rc = ofd_parse_connect_data(env, exp, data, false);
00315         if (rc == 0)
00316                 ofd_export_stats_init(ofd, exp, client_nid);
00317         else
00318                 nodemap_del_member(exp);
00319 
00320         RETURN(rc);
00321 }
00322 
00340 static int ofd_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export **_exp,
00341                            struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
00342                            struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
00343 {
00344         struct obd_export       *exp;
00345         struct ofd_device       *ofd;
00346         struct lustre_handle     conn = { 0 };
00347         int                      rc;
00348         ENTRY;
00349 
00350         if (_exp == NULL || obd == NULL || cluuid == NULL)
00351                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00352 
00353         ofd = ofd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
00354 
00355         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
00356         if (rc)
00357                 RETURN(rc);
00358 
00359         exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
00360         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
00361 
00362         if (localdata != NULL) {
00363                 rc = nodemap_add_member(*(lnet_nid_t *)localdata, exp);
00364                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -EEXIST)
00365                         GOTO(out, rc);
00366         } else {
00367                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: cannot find nodemap for client %s: "
00368                        "nid is null\n", obd->obd_name, cluuid->uuid);
00369         }
00370 
00371         rc = ofd_parse_connect_data(env, exp, data, true);
00372         if (rc)
00373                 GOTO(out, rc);
00374 
00375         if (obd->obd_replayable) {
00376                 struct tg_export_data *ted = &exp->exp_target_data;
00377 
00378                 memcpy(ted->ted_lcd->lcd_uuid, cluuid,
00379                        sizeof(ted->ted_lcd->lcd_uuid));
00380                 rc = tgt_client_new(env, exp);
00381                 if (rc != 0)
00382                         GOTO(out, rc);
00383                 ofd_export_stats_init(ofd, exp, localdata);
00384         }
00385 
00386         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: get connection from MDS %d\n", obd->obd_name,
00387                data ? data->ocd_group : -1);
00388 
00389 out:
00390         if (rc != 0) {
00391                 class_disconnect(exp);
00392                 nodemap_del_member(exp);
00393                 *_exp = NULL;
00394         } else {
00395                 *_exp = exp;
00396         }
00397         RETURN(rc);
00398 }
00399 
00411 int ofd_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
00412 {
00413         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00414         struct lu_env            env;
00415         int                      rc;
00416 
00417         ENTRY;
00418 
00419         LASSERT(exp);
00420         class_export_get(exp);
00421 
00422         if (!(exp->exp_flags & OBD_OPT_FORCE))
00423                 ofd_grant_sanity_check(ofd_obd(ofd), __FUNCTION__);
00424 
00425         rc = server_disconnect_export(exp);
00426 
00427         ofd_grant_discard(exp);
00428 
00429         /* Do not erase record for recoverable client. */
00430         if (exp->exp_obd->obd_replayable &&
00431             (!exp->exp_obd->obd_fail || exp->exp_failed)) {
00432                 rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_DT_THREAD);
00433                 if (rc)
00434                         GOTO(out, rc);
00435 
00436                 tgt_client_del(&env, exp);
00437                 lu_env_fini(&env);
00438         }
00439 out:
00440         nodemap_del_member(exp);
00441         class_export_put(exp);
00442         RETURN(rc);
00443 }
00444 
00456 static int ofd_init_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00457 {
00458         int rc;
00459 
00460         spin_lock_init(&exp->exp_filter_data.fed_lock);
00461         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&exp->exp_filter_data.fed_mod_list);
00462         atomic_set(&exp->exp_filter_data.fed_soft_sync_count, 0);
00463         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
00464         exp->exp_connecting = 1;
00465         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
00466 
00467         /* self-export doesn't need client data and ldlm initialization */
00468         if (unlikely(obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid,
00469                                      &exp->exp_client_uuid)))
00470                 return 0;
00471 
00472         rc = tgt_client_alloc(exp);
00473         if (rc == 0)
00474                 ldlm_init_export(exp);
00475         if (rc)
00476                 CERROR("%s: Can't initialize export: rc %d\n",
00477                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, rc);
00478         return rc;
00479 }
00480 
00492 static int ofd_destroy_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00493 {
00494         struct ofd_device *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00495 
00496         if (exp->exp_filter_data.fed_pending)
00497                 CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p has %lu pending on destroyed export"
00498                        "\n", exp->exp_obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
00499                        exp, exp->exp_filter_data.fed_pending);
00500 
00501         target_destroy_export(exp);
00502 
00503         if (unlikely(obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid,
00504                                      &exp->exp_client_uuid)))
00505                 return 0;
00506 
00507         ldlm_destroy_export(exp);
00508         tgt_client_free(exp);
00509 
00510         ofd_fmd_cleanup(exp);
00511 
00512         /*
00513          * discard grants once we're sure no more
00514          * interaction with the client is possible
00515          */
00516         ofd_grant_discard(exp);
00517         ofd_fmd_cleanup(exp);
00518 
00519         if (exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT)
00520                 ofd->ofd_tot_granted_clients--;
00521 
00522         if (!(exp->exp_flags & OBD_OPT_FORCE))
00523                 ofd_grant_sanity_check(exp->exp_obd, __FUNCTION__);
00524 
00525         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_filter_data.fed_mod_list));
00526         return 0;
00527 }
00528 
00541 int ofd_postrecov(const struct lu_env *env, struct ofd_device *ofd)
00542 {
00543         struct lu_device *ldev = &ofd->ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
00544         int rc;
00545 
00546         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recovery is over\n", ofd_name(ofd));
00547 
00548         if (!ofd->ofd_skip_lfsck) {
00549                 struct lfsck_start_param lsp;
00550 
00551                 lsp.lsp_start = NULL;
00552                 lsp.lsp_index_valid = 0;
00553                 rc = lfsck_start(env, ofd->ofd_osd, &lsp);
00554                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -EALREADY)
00555                         CWARN("%s: auto trigger paused LFSCK failed: rc = %d\n",
00556                               ofd_name(ofd), rc);
00557         }
00558 
00559         return ldev->ld_ops->ldo_recovery_complete(env, ldev);
00560 }
00561 
00573 static int ofd_obd_postrecov(struct obd_device *obd)
00574 {
00575         struct lu_env            env;
00576         struct lu_device        *ldev = obd->obd_lu_dev;
00577         int                      rc;
00578 
00579         ENTRY;
00580 
00581         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_DT_THREAD);
00582         if (rc)
00583                 RETURN(rc);
00584         ofd_info_init(&env, obd->obd_self_export);
00585 
00586         rc = ofd_postrecov(&env, ofd_dev(ldev));
00587 
00588         lu_env_fini(&env);
00589         RETURN(rc);
00590 }
00591 
00610 static int ofd_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00611                               __u32 keylen, void *key, __u32 vallen, void *val,
00612                               struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
00613 {
00614         int rc = 0;
00615 
00616         ENTRY;
00617 
00618         if (exp->exp_obd == NULL) {
00619                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "invalid export %p\n", exp);
00620                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00621         }
00622 
00623         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF)) {
00624                 rc = tgt_adapt_sptlrpc_conf(class_exp2tgt(exp), 0);
00625         } else {
00626                 CERROR("%s: Unsupported key %s\n",
00627                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, (char*)key);
00628                 rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00629         }
00630         RETURN(rc);
00631 }
00632 
00651 static int ofd_get_info(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00652                         __u32 keylen, void *key, __u32 *vallen, void *val)
00653 {
00654         struct ofd_thread_info          *info;
00655         struct ofd_device               *ofd;
00656         struct ll_fiemap_info_key       *fm_key = key;
00657         struct fiemap                   *fiemap = val;
00658         int                              rc = 0;
00659 
00660         ENTRY;
00661 
00662         if (exp->exp_obd == NULL) {
00663                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "invalid client export %p\n", exp);
00664                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00665         }
00666 
00667         ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00668 
00669         if (KEY_IS(KEY_FIEMAP)) {
00670                 info = ofd_info_init(env, exp);
00671 
00672                 rc = ostid_to_fid(&info->fti_fid, &fm_key->lfik_oa.o_oi,
00673                                   ofd->ofd_lut.lut_lsd.lsd_osd_index);
00674                 if (rc != 0)
00675                         RETURN(rc);
00676 
00677                 rc = ofd_fiemap_get(env, ofd, &info->fti_fid, fiemap);
00678         } else {
00679                 CERROR("%s: not supported key %s\n", ofd_name(ofd), (char*)key);
00680                 rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00681         }
00682 
00683         RETURN(rc);
00684 }
00685 
00701 int ofd_statfs_internal(const struct lu_env *env, struct ofd_device *ofd,
00702                         struct obd_statfs *osfs, __u64 max_age, int *from_cache)
00703 {
00704         int rc = 0;
00705         ENTRY;
00706 
00707         spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
00708         if (cfs_time_before_64(ofd->ofd_osfs_age, max_age) || max_age == 0) {
00709                 u64 unstable;
00710 
00711                 /* statfs data are too old, get up-to-date one.
00712                  * we must be cautious here since multiple threads might be
00713                  * willing to update statfs data concurrently and we must
00714                  * grant that cached statfs data are always consistent */
00715 
00716                 if (ofd->ofd_statfs_inflight == 0)
00717                         /* clear inflight counter if no users, although it would
00718                          * take a while to overflow this 64-bit counter ... */
00719                         ofd->ofd_osfs_inflight = 0;
00720                 /* notify ofd_grant_commit() that we want to track writes
00721                  * completed as of now */
00722                 ofd->ofd_statfs_inflight++;
00723                 /* record value of inflight counter before running statfs to
00724                  * compute the diff once statfs is completed */
00725                 unstable = ofd->ofd_osfs_inflight;
00726                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
00727 
00728                 /* statfs can sleep ... hopefully not for too long since we can
00729                  * call it fairly often as space fills up */
00730                 rc = dt_statfs(env, ofd->ofd_osd, osfs);
00731                 if (unlikely(rc))
00732                         GOTO(out, rc);
00733 
00734                 spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00735                 spin_lock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
00736                 /* calculate how much space was written while we released the
00737                  * ofd_osfs_lock */
00738                 unstable = ofd->ofd_osfs_inflight - unstable;
00739                 ofd->ofd_osfs_unstable = 0;
00740                 if (unstable) {
00741                         /* some writes committed while we were running statfs
00742                          * w/o the ofd_osfs_lock. Those ones got added to
00743                          * the cached statfs data that we are about to crunch.
00744                          * Take them into account in the new statfs data */
00745                         osfs->os_bavail -= min_t(u64, osfs->os_bavail,
00746                                                unstable >> ofd->ofd_blockbits);
00747                         /* However, we don't really know if those writes got
00748                          * accounted in the statfs call, so tell
00749                          * ofd_grant_space_left() there is some uncertainty
00750                          * on the accounting of those writes.
00751                          * The purpose is to prevent spurious error messages in
00752                          * ofd_grant_space_left() since those writes might be
00753                          * accounted twice. */
00754                         ofd->ofd_osfs_unstable += unstable;
00755                 }
00756                 /* similarly, there is some uncertainty on write requests
00757                  * between prepare & commit */
00758                 ofd->ofd_osfs_unstable += ofd->ofd_tot_pending;
00759                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_grant_lock);
00760 
00761                 /* finally udpate cached statfs data */
00762                 ofd->ofd_osfs = *osfs;
00763                 ofd->ofd_osfs_age = cfs_time_current_64();
00764 
00765                 ofd->ofd_statfs_inflight--; /* stop tracking */
00766                 if (ofd->ofd_statfs_inflight == 0)
00767                         ofd->ofd_osfs_inflight = 0;
00768                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
00769 
00770                 if (from_cache)
00771                         *from_cache = 0;
00772         } else {
00773                 /* use cached statfs data */
00774                 *osfs = ofd->ofd_osfs;
00775                 spin_unlock(&ofd->ofd_osfs_lock);
00776                 if (from_cache)
00777                         *from_cache = 1;
00778         }
00779         GOTO(out, rc);
00780 
00781 out:
00782         return rc;
00783 }
00784 
00806 int ofd_statfs(const struct lu_env *env,  struct obd_export *exp,
00807                struct obd_statfs *osfs, __u64 max_age, __u32 flags)
00808 {
00809         struct obd_device       *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00810         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00811         int                      rc;
00812 
00813         ENTRY;
00814 
00815         rc = ofd_statfs_internal(env, ofd, osfs, max_age, NULL);
00816         if (unlikely(rc))
00817                 GOTO(out, rc);
00818 
00819         /* at least try to account for cached pages.  its still racy and
00820          * might be under-reporting if clients haven't announced their
00821          * caches with brw recently */
00822 
00823         CDEBUG(D_SUPER | D_CACHE, "blocks cached "LPU64" granted "LPU64
00824                " pending "LPU64" free "LPU64" avail "LPU64"\n",
00825                ofd->ofd_tot_dirty, ofd->ofd_tot_granted, ofd->ofd_tot_pending,
00826                osfs->os_bfree << ofd->ofd_blockbits,
00827                osfs->os_bavail << ofd->ofd_blockbits);
00828 
00829         osfs->os_bavail -= min_t(u64, osfs->os_bavail,
00830                                  ((ofd->ofd_tot_dirty + ofd->ofd_tot_pending +
00831                                    osfs->os_bsize - 1) >> ofd->ofd_blockbits));
00832 
00833         /* The QoS code on the MDS does not care about space reserved for
00834          * precreate, so take it out. */
00835         if (exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS) {
00836                 struct filter_export_data *fed;
00837 
00838                 fed = &obd->obd_self_export->exp_filter_data;
00839                 osfs->os_bavail -= min_t(u64, osfs->os_bavail,
00840                                          fed->fed_grant >> ofd->ofd_blockbits);
00841         }
00842 
00843         ofd_grant_sanity_check(obd, __FUNCTION__);
00844         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, LPU64" blocks: "LPU64" free, "LPU64" avail; "
00845                LPU64" objects: "LPU64" free; state %x\n",
00846                osfs->os_blocks, osfs->os_bfree, osfs->os_bavail,
00847                osfs->os_files, osfs->os_ffree, osfs->os_state);
00848 
00849         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK_VALUE(OBD_FAIL_OST_ENOINO,
00850                                  ofd->ofd_lut.lut_lsd.lsd_osd_index))
00851                 osfs->os_ffree = 0;
00852 
00853         /* OS_STATE_READONLY can be set by OSD already */
00854         if (ofd->ofd_raid_degraded)
00855                 osfs->os_state |= OS_STATE_DEGRADED;
00856 
00857         if (obd->obd_self_export != exp && !ofd_grant_param_supp(exp) &&
00858             ofd->ofd_blockbits > COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT) {
00859                 /* clients which don't support OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM
00860                  * should not see a block size > page size, otherwise
00861                  * cl_lost_grant goes mad. Therefore, we emulate a 4KB (=2^12)
00862                  * block size which is the biggest block size known to work
00863                  * with all client's page size. */
00864                 osfs->os_blocks <<= ofd->ofd_blockbits - COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT;
00865                 osfs->os_bfree  <<= ofd->ofd_blockbits - COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT;
00866                 osfs->os_bavail <<= ofd->ofd_blockbits - COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT;
00867                 osfs->os_bsize    = 1 << COMPAT_BSIZE_SHIFT;
00868         }
00869 
00870         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK_VALUE(OBD_FAIL_OST_ENOSPC,
00871                                  ofd->ofd_lut.lut_lsd.lsd_osd_index))
00872                 osfs->os_bfree = osfs->os_bavail = 2;
00873 
00874         EXIT;
00875 out:
00876         return rc;
00877 }
00878 
00892 static int ofd_echo_setattr(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00893                             struct obdo *oa)
00894 {
00895         struct ofd_thread_info  *info;
00896         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
00897         struct ldlm_namespace   *ns = ofd->ofd_namespace;
00898         struct ldlm_resource    *res;
00899         struct ofd_object       *fo;
00900         struct lu_fid           *fid = &oa->o_oi.oi_fid;
00901         struct filter_fid       *ff = NULL;
00902         int                      rc = 0;
00903 
00904         ENTRY;
00905 
00906         info = ofd_info_init(env, exp);
00907 
00908         ost_fid_build_resid(fid, &info->fti_resid);
00909 
00910         /* This would be very bad - accidentally truncating a file when
00911          * changing the time or similar - bug 12203. */
00912         if (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLSIZE) {
00913                 static char mdsinum[48];
00914 
00915                 if (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID)
00916                         snprintf(mdsinum, sizeof(mdsinum) - 1,
00917                                  "of parent "DFID, oa->o_parent_seq,
00918                                  oa->o_parent_oid, 0);
00919                 else
00920                         mdsinum[0] = '\0';
00921 
00922                 CERROR("%s: setattr from %s trying to truncate object "DFID
00923                        " %s\n", ofd_name(ofd), obd_export_nid2str(exp),
00924                        PFID(fid), mdsinum);
00925                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPERM);
00926         }
00927 
00928         fo = ofd_object_find_exists(env, ofd, fid);
00929         if (IS_ERR(fo)) {
00930                 CERROR("%s: can't find object "DFID"\n",
00931                        ofd_name(ofd), PFID(fid));
00932                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(fo));
00933         }
00934 
00935         la_from_obdo(&info->fti_attr, oa, oa->o_valid);
00936         info->fti_attr.la_valid &= ~LA_TYPE;
00937 
00938         if (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID) {
00939                 ff = &info->fti_mds_fid;
00940                 ofd_prepare_fidea(ff, oa);
00941         }
00942 
00943         /* setting objects attributes (including owner/group) */
00944         rc = ofd_attr_set(env, fo, &info->fti_attr, ff);
00945         if (rc)
00946                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00947 
00948         ofd_counter_incr(exp, LPROC_OFD_STATS_SETATTR, NULL, 1);
00949         EXIT;
00950 out_unlock:
00951         ofd_object_put(env, fo);
00952 out:
00953         if (rc == 0) {
00954                 /* we do not call this before to avoid lu_object_find() in
00955                  *  ->lvbo_update() holding another reference on the object.
00956                  * otherwise concurrent destroy can make the object unavailable
00957                  * for 2nd lu_object_find() waiting for the first reference
00958                  * to go... deadlock! */
00959                 res = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, &info->fti_resid, LDLM_EXTENT, 0);
00960                 if (!IS_ERR(res)) {
00961                         ldlm_res_lvbo_update(res, NULL, 0);
00962                         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
00963                 }
00964         }
00965 
00966         return rc;
00967 }
00968 
00984 int ofd_destroy_by_fid(const struct lu_env *env, struct ofd_device *ofd,
00985                        const struct lu_fid *fid, int orphan)
00986 {
00987         struct ofd_thread_info *info = ofd_info(env);
00988         struct lustre_handle lockh;
00989         union ldlm_policy_data policy = { .l_extent = { 0, OBD_OBJECT_EOF } };
00990         struct ofd_object *fo;
00991         __u64 flags = LDLM_FL_AST_DISCARD_DATA;
00992         __u64 rc = 0;
00993 
00994         ENTRY;
00995 
00996         fo = ofd_object_find_exists(env, ofd, fid);
00997         if (IS_ERR(fo))
00998                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(fo));
00999 
01000         /* Tell the clients that the object is gone now and that they should
01001          * throw away any cached pages. */
01002         ost_fid_build_resid(fid, &info->fti_resid);
01003         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue_local(ofd->ofd_namespace, &info->fti_resid,
01004                                     LDLM_EXTENT, &policy, LCK_PW, &flags,
01005                                     ldlm_blocking_ast, ldlm_completion_ast,
01006                                     NULL, NULL, 0, LVB_T_NONE, NULL, &lockh);
01007 
01008         /* We only care about the side-effects, just drop the lock. */
01009         if (rc == ELDLM_OK)
01010                 ldlm_lock_decref(&lockh, LCK_PW);
01011 
01012         LASSERT(fo != NULL);
01013 
01014         rc = ofd_object_destroy(env, fo, orphan);
01015         EXIT;
01016 
01017         ofd_object_put(env, fo);
01018         RETURN(rc);
01019 }
01020 
01038 static int ofd_echo_destroy(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01039                             struct obdo *oa)
01040 {
01041         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
01042         struct lu_fid           *fid = &oa->o_oi.oi_fid;
01043         int                      rc = 0;
01044 
01045         ENTRY;
01046 
01047         ofd_info_init(env, exp);
01048 
01049         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Destroy object "DFID"\n", ofd_name(ofd), PFID(fid));
01050 
01051         rc = ofd_destroy_by_fid(env, ofd, fid, 0);
01052         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
01053                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "%s: destroying non-existent object "DFID"\n",
01054                        ofd_name(ofd), PFID(fid));
01055                 GOTO(out, rc);
01056         } else if (rc != 0) {
01057                 CERROR("%s: error destroying object "DFID": %d\n",
01058                        ofd_name(ofd), PFID(fid), rc);
01059                 GOTO(out, rc);
01060         }
01061         EXIT;
01062 out:
01063         return rc;
01064 }
01065 
01084 static int ofd_echo_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01085                            struct obdo *oa)
01086 {
01087         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
01088         struct ofd_thread_info  *info;
01089         u64                      seq = ostid_seq(&oa->o_oi);
01090         struct ofd_seq          *oseq;
01091         int                      rc = 0, diff = 1;
01092         long                     granted;
01093         u64                      next_id;
01094         int                      count;
01095 
01096         ENTRY;
01097 
01098         info = ofd_info_init(env, exp);
01099 
01100         LASSERT(seq == FID_SEQ_ECHO);
01101         LASSERT(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGROUP);
01102 
01103         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "ofd_create("DOSTID")\n", POSTID(&oa->o_oi));
01104 
01105         down_read(&ofd->ofd_lastid_rwsem);
01106         /* Currently, for safe, we do not distinguish which LAST_ID is broken,
01107          * we may do that in the future.
01108          * Return -ENOSPC until the LAST_ID rebuilt. */
01109         if (unlikely(ofd->ofd_lastid_rebuilding))
01110                 GOTO(out_sem, rc = -ENOSPC);
01111 
01112         oseq = ofd_seq_load(env, ofd, seq);
01113         if (IS_ERR(oseq)) {
01114                 CERROR("%s: Can't find FID Sequence "LPX64": rc = %ld\n",
01115                        ofd_name(ofd), seq, PTR_ERR(oseq));
01116                 GOTO(out_sem, rc = -EINVAL);
01117         }
01118 
01119         mutex_lock(&oseq->os_create_lock);
01120         granted = ofd_grant_create(env, ofd_obd(ofd)->obd_self_export, &diff);
01121         if (granted < 0) {
01122                 rc = granted;
01123                 granted = 0;
01124                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: failed to acquire grant space for "
01125                        "precreate (%d): rc = %d\n", ofd_name(ofd), diff, rc);
01126                 diff = 0;
01127                 GOTO(out, rc);
01128         }
01129 
01130         next_id = ofd_seq_last_oid(oseq) + 1;
01131         count = ofd_precreate_batch(ofd, diff);
01132 
01133         rc = ofd_precreate_objects(env, ofd, next_id, oseq, count, 0);
01134         if (rc < 0) {
01135                 CERROR("%s: unable to precreate: rc = %d\n",
01136                        ofd_name(ofd), rc);
01137         } else {
01138                 ostid_set_id(&oa->o_oi, ofd_seq_last_oid(oseq));
01139                 oa->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLID | OBD_MD_FLGROUP;
01140                 rc = 0;
01141         }
01142 
01143         ofd_grant_commit(ofd_obd(ofd)->obd_self_export, granted, rc);
01144 out:
01145         mutex_unlock(&oseq->os_create_lock);
01146         ofd_seq_put(env, oseq);
01147 
01148 out_sem:
01149         up_read(&ofd->ofd_lastid_rwsem);
01150         RETURN(rc);
01151 }
01152 
01168 static int ofd_echo_getattr(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01169                             struct obdo *oa)
01170 {
01171         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
01172         struct ofd_thread_info  *info;
01173         struct lu_fid           *fid = &oa->o_oi.oi_fid;
01174         struct ofd_object       *fo;
01175         int                      rc = 0;
01176 
01177         ENTRY;
01178 
01179         info = ofd_info_init(env, exp);
01180 
01181         fo = ofd_object_find_exists(env, ofd, fid);
01182         if (IS_ERR(fo))
01183                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(fo));
01184 
01185         LASSERT(fo != NULL);
01186         rc = ofd_attr_get(env, fo, &info->fti_attr);
01187         oa->o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID;
01188         if (rc == 0) {
01189                 __u64 curr_version;
01190 
01191                 obdo_from_la(oa, &info->fti_attr,
01192                              OFD_VALID_FLAGS | LA_UID | LA_GID);
01193 
01194                 /* Store object version in reply */
01195                 curr_version = dt_version_get(env, ofd_object_child(fo));
01196                 if ((__s64)curr_version != -EOPNOTSUPP) {
01197                         oa->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLDATAVERSION;
01198                         oa->o_data_version = curr_version;
01199                 }
01200         }
01201 
01202         ofd_object_put(env, fo);
01203 out:
01204         RETURN(rc);
01205 }
01206 
01220 static int ofd_ioc_get_obj_version(const struct lu_env *env,
01221                                    struct ofd_device *ofd, void *karg)
01222 {
01223         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
01224         struct lu_fid          fid;
01225         struct ofd_object     *fo;
01226         dt_obj_version_t       version;
01227         int                    rc = 0;
01228 
01229         ENTRY;
01230 
01231         if (data->ioc_inlbuf2 == NULL || data->ioc_inllen2 != sizeof(version))
01232                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01233 
01234         if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 != NULL && data->ioc_inllen1 == sizeof(fid)) {
01235                 fid = *(struct lu_fid *)data->ioc_inlbuf1;
01236         } else if (data->ioc_inlbuf3 != NULL &&
01237                    data->ioc_inllen3 == sizeof(__u64) &&
01238                    data->ioc_inlbuf4 != NULL &&
01239                    data->ioc_inllen4 == sizeof(__u64)) {
01240                 struct ost_id ostid;
01241 
01242                 ostid_set_seq(&ostid, *(__u64 *)data->ioc_inlbuf4);
01243                 ostid_set_id(&ostid, *(__u64 *)data->ioc_inlbuf3);
01244                 rc = ostid_to_fid(&fid, &ostid,
01245                                   ofd->ofd_lut.lut_lsd.lsd_osd_index);
01246                 if (rc != 0)
01247                         GOTO(out, rc);
01248         } else {
01249                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01250         }
01251 
01252         if (!fid_is_sane(&fid))
01253                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01254 
01255         fo = ofd_object_find(env, ofd, &fid);
01256         if (IS_ERR(fo))
01257                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(fo));
01258 
01259         if (!ofd_object_exists(fo))
01260                 GOTO(out_fo, rc = -ENOENT);
01261 
01262         if (lu_object_remote(&fo->ofo_obj.do_lu))
01263                 GOTO(out_fo, rc = -EREMOTE);
01264 
01265         version = dt_version_get(env, ofd_object_child(fo));
01266         if (version == 0)
01267                 GOTO(out_fo, rc = -EIO);
01268 
01269         *(dt_obj_version_t *)data->ioc_inlbuf2 = version;
01270 
01271         EXIT;
01272 out_fo:
01273         ofd_object_put(env, fo);
01274 out:
01275         return rc;
01276 }
01277 
01293 static int ofd_iocontrol(unsigned int cmd, struct obd_export *exp, int len,
01294                          void *karg, void __user *uarg)
01295 {
01296         struct lu_env            env;
01297         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_exp(exp);
01298         struct obd_device       *obd = ofd_obd(ofd);
01299         int                      rc;
01300 
01301         ENTRY;
01302 
01303         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "handling ioctl cmd %#x\n", cmd);
01304         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_DT_THREAD);
01305         if (rc)
01306                 RETURN(rc);
01307 
01308         switch (cmd) {
01309         case OBD_IOC_ABORT_RECOVERY:
01310                 CERROR("%s: aborting recovery\n", obd->obd_name);
01311                 obd->obd_abort_recovery = 1;
01312                 target_stop_recovery_thread(obd);
01313                 break;
01314         case OBD_IOC_SYNC:
01315                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "syncing ost %s\n", obd->obd_name);
01316                 rc = dt_sync(&env, ofd->ofd_osd);
01317                 break;
01318         case OBD_IOC_SET_READONLY:
01319                 rc = dt_sync(&env, ofd->ofd_osd);
01320                 if (rc == 0)
01321                         rc = dt_ro(&env, ofd->ofd_osd);
01322                 break;
01323         case OBD_IOC_START_LFSCK: {
01324                 struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
01325                 struct lfsck_start_param lsp;
01326 
01327                 if (unlikely(data == NULL)) {
01328                         rc = -EINVAL;
01329                         break;
01330                 }
01331 
01332                 lsp.lsp_start = (struct lfsck_start *)(data->ioc_inlbuf1);
01333                 lsp.lsp_index_valid = 0;
01334                 rc = lfsck_start(&env, ofd->ofd_osd, &lsp);
01335                 break;
01336         }
01337         case OBD_IOC_STOP_LFSCK: {
01338                 struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
01339                 struct lfsck_stop      stop;
01340 
01341                 stop.ls_status = LS_STOPPED;
01342                 /* Old lfsck utils may pass NULL @stop. */
01343                 if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 == NULL)
01344                         stop.ls_flags = 0;
01345                 else
01346                         stop.ls_flags =
01347                         ((struct lfsck_stop *)(data->ioc_inlbuf1))->ls_flags;
01348 
01349                 rc = lfsck_stop(&env, ofd->ofd_osd, &stop);
01350                 break;
01351         }
01352         case OBD_IOC_GET_OBJ_VERSION:
01353                 rc = ofd_ioc_get_obj_version(&env, ofd, karg);
01354                 break;
01355         default:
01356                 CERROR("%s: not supported cmd = %#x\n", obd->obd_name, cmd);
01357                 rc = -ENOTTY;
01358         }
01359 
01360         lu_env_fini(&env);
01361         RETURN(rc);
01362 }
01363 
01375 static int ofd_precleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
01376 {
01377         ENTRY;
01378         target_cleanup_recovery(obd);
01379         RETURN(0);
01380 }
01381 
01396 static int ofd_ping(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp)
01397 {
01398         ofd_fmd_expire(exp);
01399         return 0;
01400 }
01401 
01420 static int ofd_health_check(const struct lu_env *nul, struct obd_device *obd)
01421 {
01422         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01423         struct ofd_thread_info  *info;
01424         struct lu_env            env;
01425 #ifdef USE_HEALTH_CHECK_WRITE
01426         struct thandle          *th;
01427 #endif
01428         int                      rc = 0;
01429 
01430         /* obd_proc_read_health pass NULL env, we need real one */
01431         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_DT_THREAD);
01432         if (rc)
01433                 RETURN(rc);
01434 
01435         info = ofd_info_init(&env, NULL);
01436         rc = dt_statfs(&env, ofd->ofd_osd, &info->fti_u.osfs);
01437         if (unlikely(rc))
01438                 GOTO(out, rc);
01439 
01440         if (info->fti_u.osfs.os_state == OS_STATE_READONLY)
01441                 GOTO(out, rc = -EROFS);
01442 
01443 #ifdef USE_HEALTH_CHECK_WRITE
01444         OBD_ALLOC(info->fti_buf.lb_buf, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01445         if (info->fti_buf.lb_buf == NULL)
01446                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01447 
01448         info->fti_buf.lb_len = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
01449         info->fti_off = 0;
01450 
01451         th = dt_trans_create(&env, ofd->ofd_osd);
01452         if (IS_ERR(th))
01453                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
01454 
01455         rc = dt_declare_record_write(&env, ofd->ofd_health_check_file,
01456                                      &info->fti_buf, info->fti_off, th);
01457         if (rc == 0) {
01458                 th->th_sync = 1; /* sync IO is needed */
01459                 rc = dt_trans_start_local(&env, ofd->ofd_osd, th);
01460                 if (rc == 0)
01461                         rc = dt_record_write(&env, ofd->ofd_health_check_file,
01462                                              &info->fti_buf, &info->fti_off,
01463                                              th);
01464         }
01465         dt_trans_stop(&env, ofd->ofd_osd, th);
01466 
01467         OBD_FREE(info->fti_buf.lb_buf, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01468 
01469         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "write 1 page synchronously for checking io rc %d\n",rc);
01470 #endif
01471 out:
01472         lu_env_fini(&env);
01473         return !!rc;
01474 }
01475 
01476 struct obd_ops ofd_obd_ops = {
01477         .o_owner                = THIS_MODULE,
01478         .o_connect              = ofd_obd_connect,
01479         .o_reconnect            = ofd_obd_reconnect,
01480         .o_disconnect           = ofd_obd_disconnect,
01481         .o_create               = ofd_echo_create,
01482         .o_statfs               = ofd_statfs,
01483         .o_setattr              = ofd_echo_setattr,
01484         .o_preprw               = ofd_preprw,
01485         .o_commitrw             = ofd_commitrw,
01486         .o_destroy              = ofd_echo_destroy,
01487         .o_init_export          = ofd_init_export,
01488         .o_destroy_export       = ofd_destroy_export,
01489         .o_postrecov            = ofd_obd_postrecov,
01490         .o_getattr              = ofd_echo_getattr,
01491         .o_iocontrol            = ofd_iocontrol,
01492         .o_precleanup           = ofd_precleanup,
01493         .o_ping                 = ofd_ping,
01494         .o_health_check         = ofd_health_check,
01495         .o_set_info_async       = ofd_set_info_async,
01496         .o_get_info             = ofd_get_info,
01497 };
